question: Find the cross product of $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \\ -5 \end{pmatrix}.$
answer:
The cross product of $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \\ -5 \end{pmatrix}$ is
\[\begin{pmatrix} (-1)(-5) - (4)(2) \\ (2)(3) - (-5)(1) \\ (1)(4) - (3)(-1) \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} -3 \\ 11 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix}}.\]
agents_response:
To find the cross product of two vectors, we can use the formula:

$$\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \\ c \end{pmatrix} \times \begin{pmatrix} d \\ e \\ f \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} bf - ce \\ cd - af \\ ae - bd \end{pmatrix}$$

Using the given vectors $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \\ -5 \end{pmatrix}$:

$$\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} \times \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \\ -5 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (-1)(-5) - (4)(2) \\ (1)(-5) - (3)(2) \\ (1)(4) - (-1)(3) \end{pmatrix}$$
$$\begin{pmatrix} 5 - 8 \\ -5 - 6 \\ 4 + 3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -3 \\ -11 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix}$$

Therefore, the cross product of the two vectors is $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} -3 \\ -11 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix}}$.
